snippet: Life for about 200,000 people packed into more than 80 schools serving as shelters in Gaza is full of deprivation and discomfort.
abstract: Hundreds of thousands of people in Gaza Strip have been displaced during three-week Israeli offensive against Palestinian militants; many are packed into more than 80 schools run by the United Nations Relief and Works Agency, which cares for Palestinian refugees; UN says five of its active shelters have been hit by Israeli forces, killing dozens of people.

byline.contributor: Fares Akram contributed reporting from Beit Lahiya, and Jodi Rudoren from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: Life for about 200,000 people packed into more than 80 schools serving as shelters in Gaza is full of deprivation and discomfort.

headline.main: School Shelters in Gaza Offer Limited Safety, and Even Less Comfort
headline.print_headline: School Shelters Offer Limited Safety, and Even Less Comfort

keywords.value: United Nations Relief and Works Agency
keywords.name: organizations
